definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: You already know that my diversion is ironing.
sentences.chinese: 你已經知道了，我自己轉移注意力的方法就是熨衣服。

sentences.english: Iron the fly area of the pants, then the seams and hem of the first leg.
sentences.chinese: 熨好門襟部分，然後再熨一條褲腿上的褲邊和褲腳。

sentences.english: You should damp clothes before ironing them.
sentences.chinese: 在熨衣服之前應將衣服打溼。

sentences.english: This ceremonial dress is to be starched and pressed.
sentences.chinese: 這套夜禮服漿一漿再熨。

sentences.english: Mrs. Xu has been ironing the clothes for half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 許太已經熨衣服半個小時了。

sentences.english: The heat of these irons was different from that used by housewives.
sentences.chinese: 這些熨斗跟家庭主婦們的熨牛大不相同。

sentences.english: Running the collars and cuffs through the mangle was also Joe's idea.
sentences.chinese: 同熱軋滾筒熨領子和袖口也是喬的主意。

sentences.english: So I had finished ironing your shirt before you got up.
sentences.chinese: 所以我在你起牀前就熨好了你的襯衫。

sentences.english: He ironed out all the creases in the shirt.
sentences.chinese: 他把襯衣的所有皺痕都熨掉了。

sentences.english: Slip the waistband around the board’s narrow end, with the fly facing the floor.
sentences.chinese: 將褲腰套在熨衣板的窄的那一頭，讓門襟朝下。

sentences.english: To do ironing , they heated an iron over a fire.
sentences.chinese: 要熨衣服的話，先得在火上把熨斗燒熱。

sentences.english: Spray starch on the shirt collars before ironing them.
Following instructions on the fusing packet, iron it to the wrong side of this denim piece.
sentences.chinese: 按熨融膠包裝上的說明將它熨在牛仔布的反面。

sentences.english: Do you have an iron and ironing board that I can borrow?
sentences.chinese: 我可以借用一下你們的熨斗和熨衣板嗎？

definition: to unpick and wash (e.g. padded garment)
to clean (with water or alcohol)/to wipe and wash/to swab/to scrub
